problem.markdown: >>If B is not the null set and P(A ∩ B) = P(B), what is true about A and B? << () A is subset of B (x) B is subset of A () A and B are disjoint () A = B [Explanation] P(A ∩ B) = P(B) implies that the intersection of A and B is B itself, and that B must be wholly included in A. [Explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.label: If B is not the null set and P(A ∩ B) = P(B), what is true about A and B?

div.p: P(A ∩ B) = P(B) implies that the intersection of A and B is B itself, and that B must be wholly included in A.
